Private pay increase of salaried employees versus inflation rate

Data for Exercises 2.12 and 2.29

Format

A data frame with 24 observations on the following 5 variables.

year
a numeric vector
pay
a numeric vector
increase
a numeric vector
inflation
a numeric vector
C6.T
a factor with levels alow bmiddle high

References

Kitchens, L. J. (2003) Basic Statistics and Data Analysis. Duxbury

Examples


str(Inflatio)
#> 'data.frame':	24 obs. of  5 variables:
#>  $ year     : int  1975 1976 1977 1978 1979 1980 1981 1982 1983 1984 ...
#>  $ pay      : num  4.53 4.86 5.25 5.69 6.16 6.66 7.25 7.68 8.02 8.32 ...
#>  $ increase : num  NA 7.3 8 8.4 8.3 8.1 8.9 5.9 4.4 3.7 ...
#>  $ inflation: num  6.9 4.9 6.7 9 13.3 12.5 8.9 3.8 3.8 3.9 ...
#>  $ C6.T     : Factor w/ 3 levels "alow","bmiddle",..: 3 2 3 3 3 3 3 1 1 1 ...
#> 
attach(Inflatio)
plot(inflation,increase)
cor(inflation,increase,use="complete.obs")
#> [1] 0.8164214
#> 
detach(Inflatio)

Built by pkgdown. Styled with Bootstrap 3.
